channel.title: Al Jazeera – Breaking News, World News and Video from Al Jazeera
channel.description: Breaking News, World News and Video from Al Jazeera

image.title: Al Jazeera – Breaking News, World News and Video from Al Jazeera
image.description: Breaking News, World News and Video from Al Jazeera

item.title: US abortion advocates vow to fight expected Roe v Wade decision
item.description: In Georgia, advocates brace for six-week abortion ban if Supreme Court strikes down landmark Roe v Wade decision.

item.title: New Mexico wildfire prompts call for US disaster declaration
item.description: A wildfire near a small northeastern New Mexico community in the Rocky Mountains is expected to keep growing.

item.title: ‘Shameful’: US protests potential Roe v Wade abortion rollback
item.description: Al Jazeera speaks to protesters outside the US Supreme Court about potential overturning of Roe v Wade abortion ruling.

item.title: Two dead after building collapse in central China
item.description: At least 14 people are confirmed to be trapped in the rubble and there has been no contact with 39 others still missing.

item.title: Lyft says customers are spending on rides despite higher prices
item.description: The ride-sharing app said it surpassed expectations for both revenue and operating earnings in the first quarter.

item.title: How can journalists be protected online?
item.description: World Press Freedom Day this year highlights threats to media, especially online.

item.title: A look at some of the world’s toughest abortion laws
item.description: New limits on abortion rights are being pursued in the US and other countries.

item.title: Washington state reaches $518m settlement with opioid suppliers
item.description: Drug company McKesson will pay $197m, while AmerisourceBergen and Cardinal Health will each pay $160.5m.

item.title: Airbnb sees jump in demand as travel rebounds in North America
item.description: There are positive signs that people are itching to travel after more than two years of COVID-19 restrictions.

item.title: Ukraine live news: US helping ensure Russia ‘failure’, Biden says
item.description: US President Joe Biden says military assistance to Ukraine is a 'direct investment' in defence of democracy.

item.title: US issues visas in Cuba for first time in more than four years
item.description: Washington closed its consular services in Havana in 2017 after US personnel suffered from mystery illnesses.

item.title: Macron urges Putin to allow Mariupol steel plant evacuations
item.description: France's Emmanuel Macron urges the Russian president to restart evacuation efforts at the Azovstal plant in Ukraine.

item.title: Russia says Israel supports Ukraine ‘neo-Nazis’ as row escalates
item.description: Russian foreign ministry says Israel supports 'neo-Nazi regime in Kyiv', escalating a diplomatic dispute.

item.title: OPEC fails to boost output as members face capacity woes
item.description: The oil cartel has struggled for months to revive oil supplies halted during the coronavirus pandemic.

item.title: Ukraine’s ‘finest hour’: UK’s Johnson addresses lawmakers in Kyiv
item.description: Prime Minister Boris Johnson also announced another military aid package as he spoke to legislators via video link.

item.title: Roe v Wade: US Supreme Court says draft abortion ruling authentic
item.description: Chief Justice Roberts says leaked draft decision to overturn precedent-setting abortion ruling is real but not final.

item.title: Civilian evacuees from Azovstal plant reach Ukrainian-held city
item.description: Dozens of evacuees from Mariupol arrive in Zaporizhzhia as Russia resumes attacks on the besieged Azovstal steel plant.

item.title: US State Department says Griner ‘wrongfully detained’ by Russia
item.description: Brittney Griner has been held by Russia since February after authorities said she was carrying a vape with cannabis.

item.title: Back to bolivar? Venezuela makes bid to revive local currency
item.description: For years, the bolivar drifted towards irrelevancy as locals embraced the use of the US dollar.

item.title: Pope Francis offers to meet Putin to try to end Ukraine war
item.description: Pope Francis says he made a request to meet Russian president three weeks after Putin ordered the invasion of Ukraine.

item.title: US employers posted record 11.5 million job openings in March
item.description: The United States job market is on a red-hot streak.

item.title: Roe v Wade and state abortion policies: By the numbers
item.description: Several US states have abortion bans and restrictions that may go into effect if the landmark 1973 ruling is reversed.

item.title: Extreme heat kills at least 25 in India’s Maharashtra state
item.description: Maharashtra health official says the deaths were from 'suspected heat stroke', with many reported in rural areas.

item.title: How Europe’s biomass appetite is harming the US south
item.description: To meet their climate goals, EU countries are relying on a controversial ‘renewable’ energy source.

item.title: Slovakia, Hungary will not support EU sanctions on Russian energy
item.description: The European Union is debating new proposals for sanctions, which could include a phased-in embargo on Russian oil.
